awd_titl_txt: Taking the measure of one-dimensional dynamics - Conference
awd_abstract_narration:
This award supports the participation of US-based researchers in the conference "Taking the measure of one-dimensional dynamics" held at the Lorenz Center, University of Leiden in the Netherlands, from April 11 to 15, 2016. The conference focuses on one-dimensional dynamical systems, which describe the simplest chaotic processes but nevertheless exhibit a very rich set of behaviors. Although the theory explaining one-dimensional dynamical systems is the most complete and refined among dynamics in general, these systems are not yet fully understood.  Open questions include many shared by higher dimensional systems. The purpose of this workshop is to bring together some of the main players responsible for the development of one-dimensional dynamics with new researchers in this field, to discuss old problems, new methods, and future directions. The award funds will support eight US participants, including three graduate students and a postdoctoral researcher.
 
The conference will address many crucial themes in one-dimensional dynamics. Topics include statistical behavior, parameter dependence, renormalization, and rigidity. One-dimensional dynamics is a source of highly sophisticated techniques that can be applied to the study of higher dimensional systems, such as those used in studying Henon maps and related dynamical systems. The conference will bring together senior researchers and those newer to the field to catalyze future research progress in the subject.

More information can be found on the conference webpage: 
http://www.lorentzcenter.nl/lc/web/2016/765/info.php3?wsid=765&venue=Oort
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK

por.por_cntn:
The Intellectual Merit: The award was used to support the participation of USA mathematicians in two conferneces in Europe. The first conference "Taking the measure of one-dimensional dynamics" was held in The Lorenz Center, Leiden, the Netherlands, April 11-15, 2016. This conference concentrated on the latest developments in the theory of one-dimensional dynamical systems.  The second conference "Just a Little calculation in Dynamics" was held in The Confernece Center of the Polish Academie of Sciences, Bedlewo, Poland, August 13-19, 2017.  This conference had a broader scope than the first. In particular many branches of dynamics were discussed such as symbolic, holomorphic dynamics, Anosov diffeomorphisms., piece wise translations, and iterated function systems among others. Moreover, the award was used to support collaborations which initiated during these conferences. In total there were 12 participants whose activities were supported by the award. Three of them were PhD students and two were  post-docs. The participation of these mathematicians contributed to the dessimanation of new results and also new projects were intiated during the two conferences.

The Broader Impact: The award made it possible that young mathematicains and PhD students were able to participate in these international conferences. For some of the students these conferences were their first international conferences.

 


Last Modified: 04/09/2022
Modified by: Marco Martens
